Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2007 08:42AM LaurenBinVA wrote: I experienced the same thing when I lost 30 pounds. I could feel the underlying structures in my breast that previously had been covered with a layer of fat. If you're concerned, see your doc for a clinical breast exam to put your mind at ease!
Posts.Title: Changes Butterfly64 LaurenBinVA

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 01:31PM LaurenBinVA wrote: Thanks, Kathy.  I've just been reading about the increased risk of BC the higher the percentage of dense tissue http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/16673818/ .  It's really kind of disconcerting -- especially since I've always been told that it's nothing to be concerned with.
Posts.Title: 3 month follow-up results LaurenBinVA TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: LaurenBinVA wrote: Hi everyone.  I joined here about five months ago when I identified an unusual lump in my right breast.  All diagnostic tests were negative and I had my 3-month follow-up appointment today.  She was puzzled -- almost as puzzled as I continue to be by my breasts, which seem to be constantly changing.  She identified a predominant ridge in my left inner-upper quadrant that wasn't there last time... and the upper-outer quadrant of the right breast where there was a predominant ridge last time has coalesced into the surrounding tissue.  She wrote me a prescription for another screening mammogram to be done Feb 1st and she wants to see the films herself.  She commented that the changes in my breast tissue (becoming more dense) SHOULD be coming to an end -- after all, I'm 42 years old!  Guess it's hurry up and wait again!
